Hello:

I am fairly new to Java and JUnit as well.  I develop primarily on a
Mac.  For the most part JUnit works great on the Mac but I have an
issue that I need to solve before I can move ahead.  This issue is the
issue of classpath.  Exactly what elements of a JUnit test need on the
classpath?  I know that the junit.jar file must be visible to the
javac program.  On my Mac I have placed the junit.jar file in my
/Libray/Java/Extensions folder.  That seems to work with the swingui
module very well but when I try to run a test in textui  get an error
message back saying that myFileTest can't be found.  Does the test I
am running need to be on my classpath as well?  I am executing tests
from the command line while I am in in the current directory where the
test and files to be tested live. swingui works well.  textui gives me
errors.  Why, if swingui works well, textui fails?  They seem to be
coming from the same folder and .jar file.  

I am also trying to install JUnit on a PC and I am having similar
problems.

Anybody got any ideas?
